title: Executive Order 5307-Fishlake National Forest Enlarged
content: Under authority of the acts of Congress approved March 3, 1891 (26 Stat. 1095), and June 4, 1897 (30 Stat. 11 at 34 and 36), and on the recommendation of the Secretary of Agriculture, it is hereby ordered that the public lands within the following described areas in Utah be and the same are hereby included in and made a part of the Fishlake National Forest:
In T. 14 S., R. 3 W., secs. 33 and 34;
In T. 18 S., R. 3 W., secs. 28 to 32, inclusive, and W. ½ sec. 33;
In T. 19 S., R. 3 W., W. ½ E. ½ and W. ½ sec. 5, all sec. 6, N. ½ sec. 7, NW. ¼ and NW. ¼ NE. ¼ sec. 8;
In T. 15 S., R. 4 W., NE. ¼ NW. ¼, S. ½ NW. ¼ and SW. ¼ sec. 25, and W. ½ NW. ¼ sec. 36;
In T. 19 S., R. 4 W., secs. 1, 2, 3, N. ½ sec. 10, N. ½ sec. 11 and N. ½ sec. 12.

The withdrawal made by this order shall, as to any lands which are at this date legally appropriated under the public land laws, be subject to, and shall not interfere with or defeat legal rights thereunder, so long as such appropriation is legally maintained.
citation: Herbert Hoover, Executive Order 5307-Fishlake National Forest Enlarged Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/372925
